intro: Rapanea novocaledonica var. kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kaala rapanea, is a rare shrub native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, white flowers followed by spherical berries that are typically red when mature. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest in botanical research.
